data.title: More Talent From Scout Comics Added to Geek’d Con Lineup
data.meta_description: There's going to be a ton of comic book talent at this year's Geek'd Con. Shreveport's comic con will once again welcome the team from Scout Comics
data.text:
Shreveport's comic con, Geek'd Con, is coming back this August. The dates are August 16-18 at the Shreveport Convention Center. The event usually draws thousands of fans from around the country to meet and greet their favorite stars from movies, TV, and video games.

Geek'd Con has become one of the biggest pop culture events in the entire state of Louisiana. Drawing fans and vendors from every corner of the United States, and creating millions of dollars in economic impact for the Shreveport and Bossier City area.

Tickets for this year's Geek'd Con are available right now. You can get yours here.

The guest lineup will include horror movie icon Tony Todd, E.T. stars Henry Thomas and Dee Wallace, the voice of Master Chief Steve Downes, award winning actor Billy Zane, the voice of Mickey Mouse Bret Iwan, John C. McGinley from Scrubs (and a bunch of other great movies), and many more incredibly talented celebrities.

There will be a lot of comic book talent as well, including Scout Comics creator Mitchell Martinez!

Martinez is a graduate from California State University in Sacramento, Mitchell Martinez first had the idea for Wannabes and the main character “Zapster” since he was 12 years old. It was while in college that he took a creative writing course that helped him develop the script for issue 1.

Also during that time, Mitchell utilized the company “Scattered Comics” to find the artistic team to bring his creation to life.

A lifelong superhero fan, everything from Power Rangers to Kick-Ass, Mitchell’s passion for the subject is showcased on every page of his Scout Comics title.

There will be a chance to check out all of the work from Mitchell Martinez, and all of the other comic creators, at Geek'd Con this year.
